While researching ways to get the word out about @ EdgeSecure, I stumbled onto @ BuzzSumo. You can find key influencers by topic. It piqued my interest so I typed "Ripple XRP." This is @ Ripple t-shirt worthy, no? $ XRP # xrpthestandardpic.twitter.com/cRGR6EQ7Nh
He said something like Ripple dropped the "Labs" because they came out of the lab. Right over my head. I completely missed that. I only remember my Google searches being ruined, lol.

I was thinking about this post a lot over the weekend. I want to do more outreach this summer, especially on college campuses. Our Bitcoin meetups have grown so much, but not with the under 22yo crowd for some reason.
Of course. You don't remember when Ripple was in beta? Nik thought maybe when Ripple dropped the "Labs" is when they came out of beta.
Does this mean that Ripple is out of beta? LOL. For some reason, I was thinking about that the other day and how I don’t remember ever reading an announcement, hahaha.

Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum, ZCash, Monero, etc have never had to advertise.

Bitcoin doesn't have a marketing team so won't have any impact on the one crypto I'm interested in personally. Re: the ICOs, while I'm not interested in them, I assume any that had to advertise was probably a scam anyway so good decision by TWTR.

I'd go further. Many of those kids have kept track of Bitcoin since then. That kind of mindshare is worth way more than $100. If even one of them ends up being close to the next Alex Morcos or Liz Stark or Tuur Demeester, it's well worth it IMO.
